704207f-a.text:
Flatbush Ave. (right) south of Eastern Parkway, showing prominently the $1,000,000 political football, that was to have been the Central Library of Brooklyn, but it was never completed. To the left, partially seen, is the domed structure, known as the Brooklyn Institute of Arts and Sciences. The elevated land to the left of the Library is the Mt. Prospect Reservoir. View No. 2 shows the $1,000,000 scandal being demolished for the erection of a new library.
January 1, 1937.
View 2: June 12, 1938.
P. L. Sperr.
704207f-a.folder: Flatbush Avenue & Eastern Parkway, Brooklyn, NY

704067f-b.text: Eastern Parkway and Flatbush Avenue, showing the central building of the Brooklyn Public Library. September 2, 1941. Eastern Pkwy. from Plaza Street. Brooklyn Public Library. August 30, 1942. P. L. Sperr.
